ARSENAL CLOSE IN ON SALIBA

Arsenal are close to agreeing a deal with Saint-Etienne for defender William Saliba, according to Sky sources.

The deal would see Saliba return on loan to the French club next season.

Tottenham are also in talks with Saint-Etienne, but have yet to make formal offer.

Saint-Etienne believed to be waiting for Spurs to bid before deciding on Saliba’s next destination in an attempt to push price up.

Saliba is thought to prefer a move to the Emirates.

ARSENAL NEAR CEBALLOS LOAN

Arsenal are increasingly hopeful of completing a loan deal for Real Madrid midfielder Dani Ceballos, according to Sky sources.

It is understood that Real initially preferred to sell Ceballos, but changed their mind after he impressed in the Euro U21 championship.

The deal will go through once Real boss Zinedine Zidane gives final approval.

Tottenham were also in talks for the player, but it is thought they wanted to do a permanent deal for Ceballos.

The England defender wants to fight for a first team place next season – but will consider leaving North London if a sufficiently attractive opportunity comes along.

Sky Sports News understands that Tottenham will be looking to recoup £20m for the left-back, whom they bought from Leeds for £1m in 2007.

Bundesliga team Schalke are also understood to be keen on signing the 29-year old defender, who has been left out of Spurs' tour to Singapore to explore transfer possibilities.

Spurs are interested in signing Fulham’s Ryan Sessegnon if Rose leaves the club.

Inter, Dzeko a target for the attack: the latest

During today’s press conference Antonio Conte expressed his frustration with the lack of strikers on the roster and the difficulties in making progress on the transfer market. The nerazzurri’s directors are working on satisfying their new manager.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/inter-dzeko-a-target-for-the-attack-the-latest

Roma-Milan, from Suso to Zaniolo & Schick

After completing the deal for Jordan Veretout, Roma are focused on the attack. The giallorossi are working on signing Suso, a player new manager Fonseca has specifically requested, but Milan hold the Spaniard born in ‘93 in high regard- they want close to €40 million which is the value of his exit clause.

Milan have asked about Niccolo’ Saniolo, but Roma do not want to sell the young midfielder, while Cengiz Under could be another player of interest to the rossoneri. Patrik Schick could also be included in the deal but the former Sampdoria striker is also a target for Bayer Leverkusen and Borussia Dortmund.

https://gianlucadimarzio.com/en/roma-milan-from-suso-to-zaniolo-schick

The goal is to try and make progress after the first contacts over the last few days.

Inter's directors met at the headquarters of Suning, to discuss the nerazzurri's approach to the transfer market. Regarding the Manchester United attacker, who Inter consider the piece to bring the club up a level, he has selected Inter but must find an agreement on wages.
